Wouw! Burger McDonald's Ini Tidak Membusuk Setelah Disimpan 10 Tahun
05 Nov 2019, 05:30 by Riska Fitria - detikFood


Foto: Istimewa

Jakarta - Orang ini menyimpan burger yang dibeli dari McDonald's sejak 10 tahun lalu. Uniknya, sampai sekarang burger tersebut tidak berubah wujud dan tampak masih bisa dimakan.Islandia merupakan negara yang jarang terdapat gerai McDonald's. Banyak gerai McDonalds di sana yang memilih untuk tidak beroperasi. Terakhir, McDonald's menutup gerai terakhirnya di Islandia pada 10 tahun yang lalu.Pada saat penutupan gerai McDonald's pada 31 Oktober 2009 lalu, seorang bernama Hjortur Smarason mendapat kehormatan untuk membeli burger McDonald's terakhir yang dijual di Islandia, lapor Odditycentral (1/11).


Foto: Istimewa

Hjortur membeli burger McDonald's tersebut sebagai kenang-kenangan dan dengan maksud untuk membuktikan desas-desus yang selama ini beredar. Mereka mengatakan burger McDonald's tidak membusuk meski telah disimpan dalam jangka waktu yang lama. Selain burger, ia juga membeli kentang goreng."Saya memutuskan untuk membeli makanan terakhir karena nilai historisnya, sebelum McDonald's ini benar-benar tutup," ujar Hjortur.Setelah membeli burger dan kentang goreng McDonald's, Hjortur langsung menyimpan kedua makanan itu dengan memasukkannya ke dalam kantong plastik dan membiarkannya tak tersentuh selama tiga tahun.


Foto: Istimewa

Baca Juga : Pertama dalam Sejarah Fast Food, McD Sajikan Burger Wagyu Juicy! Sangat mengejutkan setelah tiga tahun disimpan tanpa disentuh sedikit pun, tampilan pada kentang goreng dan burger McDonald's tersebut benar-benar tidak berubah, mulai dari warna sampai pada bentuknya. Bahkan nampak seperti masih bisa dimakan. Dari hasil simpanannya, Hjortur memutuskan untuk meminjamkannya ke Museum Nasional Islandia selama beberapa tahun. Kemudian kentang goreng dan burger McDonald's tersebut sempat dipindahkan ke Hostel Bus Reykjav√≠k, baru akhirnya ditempatkan di Snotra House, sebuah bangunan asrama yang berada di Thykkvibaer, Islandia Selatan. Di asrama Snotra House, kentang goreng dan burger McDonald's ditaruh di dalam wadah kaca dan dijadikan pajangan seperti layaknya karya seni. Mungkin kamu berpikir bahwa pajangan kentang goreng dan burger McDonald's berumur 10 tahun itu tidak menarik perhatian.


Foto: Istimewa

Namun, kenyataannya justru banyak orang yang berbondong-bondong datang ke Snotra Hpuse untuk melihat kentang goreng dan burger McDonald's terakhir di Islandia. Hal tersebut disampaikan oleh Sigurdur Gylfason, selaku pemilik asrama. Dalam sehari, terhitung sebanyak 400.000 orang datang untuk melihat pajangan tersebut.Juru bicara Snotra House mengatakan bahwa hingga sampai saat ini, baik kentang goreng maupun burger McDonald belum membusuk sama sekali. Hanya saja tekstur pada rotinya telah berubah menjadi lebih keras.


Foto: Istimewa

Pihak McDonald's menanggapi kondisi makanannya yang dijadikan pajangan. Menurut mereka, kentang goreng dan burger Mcdonalds tidak akan membusuk selama tidak disimpan dalam keadaan yang lembab."Agar dekomposisi terjadi, itu memerlukan kondisi tertentu khususnya kelembaban. Tanpa kelembaban yang cukup, baik dalam makanan itu sendiri atau lingkungan, maka bakteri dan jamur tidak akan tumbuh," ujar McDonald's.Baca Juga : Terungkap! Wow! McDonald's Burger Does Not Rot After Ten Years in Storage
05 Nov 2019, 05:30 by Riska Fitria - detikFood


Photo: Special

Jakarta - This person keeps a burger that was bought from McDonald's since 10 years ago. Uniquely, until now the burger has not changed shape and looks can still be eaten. Iceland is a country that rarely has a McDonald's outlet. Many McDonalds outlets there choose not to operate. Finally, McDonald's closed its last store in Iceland 10 years ago. At the closing of the McDonald's store on October 31, 2009, a person named Hjortur Smarason had the honor of buying the last McDonald's burger sold in Iceland, reports Odditycentral (1/11).


Photo: Special

Hjortur bought the McDonald's burger as a memento and with a view to proving the rumors that had been circulating so far. They say McDonald's burgers don't rot even though it's been stored for a long time. Besides burgers, he also bought french fries. "I decided to buy the last meal because of its historical value, before McDonald's was completely closed," said Hjortur. After buying a burger and fries McDonald's, Hjortur immediately save the two foods by putting it in plastic bag and left it untouched for three years.


Photo: Special

Also Read: First in the History of Fast Food, McD Serve Juicy Wagyu Burger! Very surprising after three years of being stored without the slightest touch, the appearance of the McDonald's fries and burgers was completely unchanged, from the color to its shape. It even looks like it's still edible. From the results of his savings, Hjortur decided to lend it to the Icelandic National Museum for several years. Then the McDonald's fries and burgers were moved to the Reykjavik Bus Hostel, and finally placed at Snotra House, a dormitory building in Thykkvibaer, Southern Iceland. At the Snotra House hostel, McDonald's fries and burgers are placed in glass containers and made into displays like works of art. Maybe you think that a display of 10-year-old McDonald's fries and burgers doesn't attract attention.


Photo: Special

However, the reality is that many people flock to Snotra Hpuse to see the last McDonald's fries and burgers in Iceland. This was conveyed by Sigurdur Gylfason, as the owner of the hostel. In a day, counted as many as 400,000 people came to see the display. A spokesman for Snotra House said that until now, neither the french fries nor the McDonald's burgers had rotted at all. It's just that the texture on the bread has changed to become harder.


Photo: Special

McDonald's responds to the condition of the food that is used as a display. According to them, french fries and Mcdonalds burgers will not rot as long as they are not stored in moist conditions. "For decomposition to occur, it requires certain conditions especially humidity. Without enough moisture, either in the food itself or the environment, bacteria and fungi will not grow, "said McDonald's. Also Read: Revealed!
